intro: Monochaetum candollei, commonly known as the candolle's monochaetum, is a flowering plant native to New Caledonia. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae, which is closely related to the grass family. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. It produces small, clustered inflorescences with pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
